result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan A Schroeder was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant may petition for a resitution hearing within 30 days - hearing to be held within 60 days. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.
**ON JUNE 15, 2016 A RESTITUTION HEARING WAS HELD-COURT ORDERED RESTITUTION IN THE AMOUNT OF $1631.50 TO BE PAID IN INCREMENTS OF NO LESS THAN $150.00 PER MONTH COMMENCING JULY 1, 2016**

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to obtain and maintain full time employment.  Defendant to obtain a GED or HSED during the pendency of probation term.

No contact with S. Lipp directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Exhibits #1-#6

Defendant Jordan A Schroeder in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion between counsel and court. State calls Shyan Mary Lipp, witness sworn, testimony given. Exhibits #1, #2, #3, & #4 offered and received. Cross exam by Attorney Zamzow. Exhibit #5, #6 offered and received. Court questions witness. Re-direct by State. Court makes itemized statement and enters an order for restitution in the amount of $1631.50 to be paid in increments of no less than $150.00 per month commencing July 1, 2016.
Restitution hearing on June 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
from Atty Zamzow requesting adjournment - Granted by the Court - the Court finds that good cause exists to adjourn the restitution hearing beyond the 60 day time limitation
from Atty Zamzow detailing all of the disputed components of restitution
Restitution hearing on May 27, 2016 at 11:00 am.
from Atty Zamzow requesting a restitution hearing

Case called @ 3:22 p.m. Defendant Jordan A Schroeder in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Upon motion of the State the Court amends Ct 1 to Misdemeanor Theft contrary to Wis Stat 943.20(1)(a). Plea: NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Atty Zamzow argues for expungment. Statement by ADA Anderson. Statement by DE. Court orders: 6 mos WCJ - Huber, GT, No CFTS - I/S - 1 year probation - Conditions: 30 days WC Jail - Huber, No GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence by no later than May 1, 2016,  NC w/ S. Lipp, AODA and follow through, defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DE to obtain an HSED or GED, Maintain gainful employment,  Restitution in the amount of $3320, Defendant may petititon the court for a restitution hearing within 30 days,  Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 04-01-2016 03:15 pm

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Zamzow requesting another STC.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 1, 2016 at 03:15 pm.

Status conference at 02-29-2016 02:15 pm

2:14 pm case called. Defendant Jordan A Schroeder in court with attorney Jeanne Lila Zamzow.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing. Court has read the criminal complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order binding the defendant over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Zamzow confirms receipt, waives formal reading and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts.    STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Initial appearance at 01-27-2016 02:15 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 1:48 PM: Defendant Jordan A Schroeder in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Defendant advised of right to counsel.  Def wants counsel has not yet contacted SPD.  Def employed full time, though currently not working full time hours.  Def is referred to SPD for eligibility.  Court orders Signature Bond of $5000.00 w/conditions.   IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Defendant to meet with SPD immediately following court today.  Initial appearance scheduled for January 27, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
